subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight

Hi Deb,
 
Let's just say, when any researcher tries to do a public box ses=
sion for people that 
have not only never heard a box but did not even know=
 what one is until the actual demonstration.
 
Let's just say you will have=
 99.9% of the people walking away going "what was that, the guy was listeni=
ng to a scrambled radio
and asking it questions"
 
The chances are, even if=
 the audience where familiar with the box and the theory and technical func=
tioning that allows for real time communication
with spirits. they would no=
t on their first or maybe even their tenth attempt hear any words or respon=
ses to questions.
 
Not to mention, the demonstrator better hope that he or=
 she has somewhat favorable conditions for a successful session.
It is just=
 not a good practice unless your audience has some knowledge and experience=
 with a box of some type.
 
Any public session I have heard of left the maj=
ority of individuals involved with a sour taste for box research.
And that =
includes Staten Island ,Halloween night or so I've been told. by the presen=
ter himself.
 
That's why if you ask the original box inventor he will tell=
 you that his intention was for the box to be a stationary research tool.
n=
ot a location device.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
From: Debbie@...: Sun, 3 Feb 2008 17:45:35 +0000Subject: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: File from tonight




Hi Bruce .. What happened on Halloween on =
SI?? I was planning to stop by!Debbie--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce =
halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Steve,> > I listened to t=
he file, It could have said what is labeled.> It was kinda rough and I don'=
t think anyone but an experienced> researcher used to listening to Frank's =
box would hear anything> from the random mode especially.> > I think you ma=
y have gotten caught up in the moment, I know those group sessions can get =
exciting.> My advice would be to hold off on any public display sessions un=
til we refine the communivation to > where the average listener is capable =
of hearing a response. Don't forget what happened on halloween in staten Is=
land.> Or what happened to those knuckle heads at pulse radio.> > I think i=
t would be detrimental to the research not to go somewhere and have a group=
 of people hear nothing but what > they discern as noise. for the simple re=
ason that they are not equiped to hear the actual responses.> > Just my opi=
nion as afriend and fellow researcher. also I believe our friend Frank beli=
eves that the box was not meant > for field work and does not perform to th=
e best of it's ability in a public situation.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > =
> To: EVP-ITC@...: urkel23@...: Sat, 2 Feb 2008 22:11:07 -0500Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] File from tonight> > > > > > > I have been having weird sessions with=
 Frank's Box #27, but in a good way. They told me to change the antenna, wh=
ich it did and the random started working and never has on this box. They t=
old me tonight to put the old antenna back on and the sessions keep getting=
 better and better. I dragged Juli and Joel in on what i believed and felt =
was going to be a great box session and here is a file only a couple minute=
s in to our hour long session. This is a bit rough sounding, but hearing it=
 live is pretty clear and you can hear me respond and than Joel agrees that=
 he heard it too. My sessions are pretty incredible since the random mode s=
tarted working on the FB#27 and i feel the random is the best thing out the=
re...hands down. I have done Sessions on the internet through Skype all wee=
k and i feel the energy between Juli and I are really bringing them through=
 clearly. I only use FB#27 now in random mode and it is the best feature on=
 any box, between the white noise, echo and random there is no competetion =
up to this point. The hacks are good, but nothing is better than an origina=
l frank's box. Our friends on the other side told me that they fixed the ra=
ndom mode to go and teach others and i am going to a meeting on wednesday t=
o demonstrate the different boxes and our friend made a promise to come tho=
ugh if i go....so we will see.> > Here is one of the files i got so far.> >=

ws for real time communication<BR>
